reviews.review_msg: Poor grading and instruction criteria, course assignments somewhat unrelated to course, inaccessible, seemed to pawn everything off to TA so take this review with a grain of salt with respect to the marking. Textbook used was ANCIENT, with typos in it, overall just disappointed with the course. Didn't learn much thats for sure.
Wanda knows her stuff and probes her students to think and to learn. She is very knowledgeable, kind, and facilitates whole group discussion. I am learning all kinds of things being in her seminar.

Absolutely horrible. I didn't have much contact with her until I had an issue with the course, and she was absolutely terrible and condescending. Would not help me at all, did not see my side of things, and laughed at my concerns on several occasions. Awful lady. Cannot believe she is allowed to teach students. Incredibly narcissistic.
Very hard, assignments are vague and unclear. Extremely difficult to do well in what I thought would be a GPA boost
Assessment and requirements for exams are unclear.

She is, by far, the best prof I have had. She is very knowledgeable and passionate about her subject and makes her classes engaging and informative. What I learned in her class exceeded my expectations. Thank you for such a fantastic experience!!
She's one of the most dedicated profs in the Education faculty and as long as you do the work, you should get an A- or above.
Works hard to help us all out... has been under a lot of stress.

This prof is completely out of touch with her students.  The workload she demanded(2 group projects with power point presentations and essays, long final paper, and 10 pages of double entry journals)was insane.  No one in the class could keep up with the readings. Did she want us to take up time presenting so she wouldn't have to teach? GET REAL!!!
Took a couple of classes with her.  A bit flaky but okay.
